newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australia says no T-note sale this week.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australia says no T-note sale this week.

text.p: The Australian Treasury said there would be no Treasury note tender this week.
The Treasury last week offered a total of A$500 million of notes, comprising A$200 million of 13-week notes and A$300 million of 26-week notes.
There are A$530 million of non-official holdings of T-notes maturing in the week ending September 4.
"Basically we issue Treasury notes to cover any shortfalls in cash that the government might have," a Treasury spokesman told Reuters.

"In the last couple of days we have had around A$2.0 billion worth of company tax being paid, so the Commonwealth's cash balance is going to be fairly flush for this coming week and there is no real need for us to issue notes," he said.
